sections.text: Effect of acknowledgment of claim by representativeThe acknowledgment of a claim by the succession representative, as provided in Article 3242, shall:(1) Entitle the creditor to have his claim included in the succession representative's petition for authority to pay debts, or in his tableau of distribution, for payment in due course of administration;(2) Create a prima facie presumption of the validity of the claim, even if it is not included in the succession representative's petition for authority to pay debts, or in his tableau of distribution; and(3) Suspend the running of prescription against the claim as long as the succession is under administration.
